intro: Acetosella pohliana, commonly known as the Pohli's sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with reddish veins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
